games.title: BeetleBall
games.description: BeetleBall is an online multiplayer soccer game with multiple unique beetle classes. My team and I will be releasing it to Steam in 2025.

games.title: RO:CK VR
games.description: A virtual reality combat sandbox featuring active ragdolls and a physically simulated player.

games.title: Gun^Gun
games.description: With the use of a tree-like node attachment system, players can attach guns to guns and create massive gun monstrosities.

games.title: Big Beautiful Balloon
games.description: I programmed the balloon movement and physics to feel like a real balloon and it turned out amazing. I also designed the level, which was a fun challenge!

games.title: Bartholomew Bone's Adventure
games.description: This game has four enemy types with different AI behaviour, including a final boss fight.

games.title: Kraken's Lair
games.description: A VR prototype created using various Quest 3 SDK's. The game constructs a 3D mesh from the host's real life room data that all players can move around in.

games.title: Hell NO
games.reason: 3rd Place Winner | BIGA $5000 Mini Game Challenge
games.description: The goal of this project was to create a simple yet polished game in one week. Our effort paid off and we got third place!

games.title: Jambulance
games.description: Using various sensors, the traffic is programmed to feel as though all of the cars are escaping a city.

games.title: RELEASE THE MEAT
games.reason: Top 100 Submission | Ludum Dare 53 Game Jam
games.description: This was my first game jam, and although there were hiccups, in only three days I was left with a game I am very proud of.

games.title: C++ Tetris
games.reason: Final Project | ICS 214 - Programming from C to C++
games.description: After learning C++ and coding small programs, I was tasked with this project, a Tetris clone created using C++ and SFML.

tools.title: Command Console
tools.description: An in game debug console for Unity. Commands are created via a custom attribute above a method, and are found automatically via reflection.

tools.title: SpleenTween
tools.description: A performant tweening library for Unity that uses C# callbacks. Its simple interface makes it easy to smoothly interpolate between values.

tools.title: Scriptable Harmony
tools.description: A package that uses ScriptableObjects to decouple code and streamline workflows in Unity, inspired by Ryan Hipple's Unite 2017 talk.

tools.title: NExtensions
tools.description: A toolbox of extension methods, custom classes, timers, and other helpful tools to speed up development.
